page.title: 18 - CLUBS, ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content:
There is a thriving folk club which meets regularly during the winter months in the Duncton Village Hall and several well known people such as Frank Ifield have performed there.
Because of the natural beauty of the area many artists come to paint the local scene. Members of art clubs are frequently seen at weekends sitting at their easels, particularly at Burton Pond and in the woodland.
Two or three times a year craftsmen display their jewelry, ceramics and paintings etc, at an exhibition held at Mansby Cottage, Coates.
A retired farmer at Duncton who is an expert at making corn dollies, gives lessons at evening classes in Petworth
